fields.description: *Assessment* After setting up HTTPS service endpoints on a Eucalyptus 4.2 cloud, DNS spoofing was enabled in order for instances to use AWS region FQDNs for service endpoints. Resolution works fine, however service API requests fail: {code} ### Resolution to UFS ### ubuntu@euca-172-31-12-59:~$ nslookup ec2.us-east-1.amazonaws.com Server: 10.111.1.41 Address: 10.111.1.41#53 Name: ec2.us-east-1.amazonaws.com Address: 10.111.1.41 ### AWS CLI call #### ubuntu@euca-172-31-12-59:~$ aws --ca-bundle euca-ca-0.crt --endpoint-url https://ec2.us-east-1.amazonaws.com ec2 describe-key-pairs A client error (404 Not Found) occurred when calling the DescribeKeyPairs operation: unknown {code} Using the Eucalyptus FQDN works just fine though: {code} ubuntu@euca-172-31-12-59:~$ aws --ca-bundle euca-ca-0.crt --endpoint-url https://ec2.c-06.autoqa.qa1.eucalyptus-systems.com/ ec2 describe-key-pairs { "KeyPairs": [ { "KeyName": "devops-admin", "KeyFingerprint": "ee:4f:93:a8:87:8d:80:8d:2c:d6:d5:60:20:a3:2d:b2" } ] } {code} This error was discovered while trying to use the [Cloudwatch plugin with Grafana|http://docs.grafana.org/datasources/cloudwatch/]. Grafana is used by QA to monitor instances and physical machines in the QA environment. *Signs* * Debug output of AWS CLI {code} ubuntu@euca-172-31-12-59:~$ aws --ca-bundle euca-ca-0.crt --endpoint-url https://ec2.us-east-1.amazonaws.com ec2 describe-key-pairs --debug 2015-11-12 03:05:25,280 - MainThread - awscli.clidriver - DEBUG - CLI version: aws-cli/1.9.6 Python/2.7.10 Linux/4.2.0-17-generic botocore/1.3.6 2015-11-12 03:05:25,281 - MainThread - awscli.clidriver - DEBUG - Arguments entered to CLI: ['--ca-bundle', 'euca-ca-0.crt', '--endpoint-url', 'https://ec2.us-east-1.amazonaws.com', 'ec2', 'describe-key-pairs', '--debug'] 2015-11-12 03:05:25,281 - MainThread - botocore.hooks - DEBUG - Event session-initialized: calling handler 2015-11-12 03:05:25,281 - MainThread - botocore.hooks - DEBUG - Event session-initialized: calling handler 2015-11-12 03:05:25,282 - MainThread - botocore.credentials - DEBUG - Skipping environment variable com.eucalyptus.objectstorage.pipeline.ObjectStorageFormPOSTPipeline {code} *Steps* # Set up Eucalyptus 4.2 cloud with Eucalyptus DNS and HTTPS endpoints - see DOC-1699. Cloud - [hspencer-74|http://jenkins.qa1.eucalyptus-systems.com/job/Quick%20Launch%20Maint-4.2/74/]. When creating CSR, make sure and [add Subject Alternative Names|https://rtcamp.com/wordpress-nginx/tutorials/ssl/multidomain-ssl-subject-alternative-names/] for all the supported AWS services for the given region thats being tested. For example: {code} $ openssl req -in wildcard.c-06.autoqa.qa1.eucalyptus-systems.com.csr -noout -text | less X509v3 Subject Alternative Name: DNS:ec2.us-east-1.amazonaws.com, DNS:autoscaling.us-east-1.amazonaws.com, DNS:cloudformation.us-east-1.amazonaws.com, DNS:monitoring.us-east-1.amazonaws.com, DNS:elasticloadbalancing.us-east-1.amazonaws.com, DNS:s3.amazonaws.com, DNS:sts.us-east-1.amazonaws.com {code} # Set DNS spoofing: {code} [root@d-17 ~]# euctl dns.spoof_regions --region euca-admin@future dns.spoof_regions.enabled = true dns.spoof_regions.region_name = dns.spoof_regions.spoof_aws_default_regions = true dns.spoof_regions.spoof_aws_regions = true {code} # Launch an instance, and allow SSH access # SSH into the instance and install AWS CLI {code} ubuntu@euca-172-31-12-59:~$ sudo apt-get install -y python-pip ubuntu@euca-172-31-12-59:~$ sudo -H pip install --upgrade pip ubuntu@euca-172-31-12-59:~$ sudo -H pip install --upgrade awscli {code} # Run {{aws configure}} and set access and secret key information if not using instance profile # Confirm AWS CLI works with HTTPS Eucalyptus service endpoint {code} ubuntu@euca-172-31-12-59:~$ aws --ca-bundle euca-ca-0.crt --endpoint-url https://ec2.c-06.autoqa.qa1.eucalyptus-systems.com/ ec2 describe-key-pairs { "KeyPairs": [ { "KeyName": "devops-admin", "KeyFingerprint": "ee:4f:93:a8:87:8d:80:8d:2c:d6:d5:60:20:a3:2d:b2" } ] } {code} # Test against AWS FQDN service endpoint that matches one of the SANs in the signed certificate: {code} ubuntu@euca-172-31-12-59:~$ aws --ca-bundle euca-ca-0.crt --endpoint-url https://ec2.us-east-1.amazonaws.com ec2 describe-key-pairs A client error (404 Not Found) occurred when calling the DescribeKeyPairs operation: unknown {code}
fields.summary: DNS Spoofing Returns Errors for AWS FQDN endpoints when using HTTPS

comments.body: Fixed issue with service pipelines incorrectly rejecting requests using hosts with a '-' in the region name. Fixed issue with configuration of the region name causing spoofing of other regions to fail.
I am fine with including in 4.2.2 if [~tony] is fine with that.
Moved this issue back to confirmed state for fix in 4.2.2.

Issue has been fixed.  Refer to QA-505 for steps.

Eucalyptus Version: {{4.2.2-0.24187.20.20160329git4b58c04.el6}}
